definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE SETUP REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the AMF and is used
to request the NG-RAN node to assign resources on Uu and NG-U for one or
several PDU session resources.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Setup Request List
PDU Session Resource Setup Request Item IEs
PDU Session Resource Setup Request Transfer
elementList.description: Containing the PDU Session Resource Setup Request Transfer IE specified in subclause 9.3.4.1.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of PDU sessions allowed towards one
  UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE SETUP RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node as
a response to the request to assign resources on Uu and NG-U for one or several
PDU session resources.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Setup Response List
PDU Session Resource Setup Response Item IEs
PDU Session Resource Setup Response Transfer
elementList.description: Containing the PDU Session Resource Setup Response Transfer IE specified in subclause 9.3.4.2.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Failed to Setup List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of PDU sessions allowed towards one
  UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE RELEASE COMMAND
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the AMF and is used
to request the NG-RAN node to release already established PDU session resources
for a given UE.

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE RELEASE RESPONSE

a response to the request to release already established PDU session resources
for a given UE.

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE MODIFY REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the AMF and is used
to request the NG-RAN node to enable modifications of already established PDU session
resources for a given UE.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Modify Request List

PDU Session Resource Modify Request Transfer
elementList.description: Containing the PDU Session Resource Modify Request Transfer IE specified in subclause 9.3.4.3.

  UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE MODIFY RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the NG-RAN node and
is used to report the outcome of the request from the PDU

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Modify Response List

PDU Session Resource Modify Response Transfer
elementList.description: Containing the PDU Session Resource Modify Response Transfer IE specified in subclause 9.3.4.4.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Failed to Modify List

rangeBoundList.explanation:

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE NOTIFY
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to notify
that the already established QoS flow(s) or PDU session resource(s) for a given
UE are released or not fulfilled anymore or fulfilled again by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Notify Item IEs
PDU Session Resource Notify Transfer
elementList.description: Containing the PDU Session Resource Notify Transfer IE specified in subclause 9.3.4.5.

rangeBoundList.explanation:

  UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE MODIFY INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node and is used to request the AMF to enable modifications of already
established PDU session resources for a given UE.

PDU Session Resource Modify Indication Item IEs

elementList.description: Containing the PDU Session Resource Modify Indication Transfer IE specified in subclause 9.3.4.6.

rangeBoundList.explanation:

definitionList.name: PDU SESSION RESOURCE MODIFY CONFIRM
descriptionList:
This message
is sent by the AMF and is used
to confirm the outcome of the
request from the PDU SESSION RESOURCE MODIFY INDICATION
message.

This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
request the release of the UE-associated logical NG-connection over the NG
interface.

This message is sent by the AMF to request
the release of the UE-associated logical NG-connection over the NG interface.

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE COMPLETE

This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
confirm the release of the UE-associated logical NG-connection over the NG
interface.

definitionList.name: NG RESET
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the NG-RAN
node and the AMF to request that the NG interface, or parts of the NG
interface, be reset.
definitionList.direction: Direction: NG-RAN node → AMF and AMF → NG-RAN node

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of UE-associated logical
  NG-connections allowed to reset in one message. Value is 8192.

definitionList.name: NG RESET ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the NG-RAN
node and the AMF as a response to an NG RESET message.
definitionList.direction: Direction: NG-RAN node → AMF and AMF → NG-RAN node

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of UE-associated logical
  NG-connections allowed to reset in one message. Value is 8192.

definitionList.name: ERROR INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by both the NG-RAN
node and the AMF to indicate that some error has been detected in the node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: NG-RAN node → AMF and AMF → NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: UPLINK RAN CONFIGURATION TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node in
order to transfer RAN configuration information.

definitionList.name: DOWNLINK RAN CONFIGURATION TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the AMF in order to
transfer RAN configuration information.

definitionList.name: WRITE-REPLACE WARNING REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the AMF to request
the start or overwrite of the broadcast of a warning message.

definitionList.name: WRITE-REPLACE WARNING RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
acknowledge the AMF on the start or overwrite request of a warning message.

definitionList.name: PWS CANCEL REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is forwarded by the AMF to the
NG-RAN node to cancel an already ongoing broadcast of a warning message.

definitionList.name: PWS CANCEL RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
indicate the list of warning areas where cancellation of the broadcast of the
identified message was successful and unsuccessful.

definitionList.name: PWS RESTART INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
inform the AMF that PWS information for some or all cells of the NG-RAN node
are available for reloading from the CBC if needed.

elementList.name: Emergency Area ID List for Restart

Maximum no. of cells that
  can be served by a gNB. Value is 16384.

Maximum no. of TAIs subject for reloading warning message broadcast. Value
  is 2048.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area IDs subject for reloading warning message broadcast.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: PWS FAILURE INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
inform the AMF that ongoing PWS operation for one or more cells of the NG-RAN
node has failed.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of cells that can be served by an
  ng-eNB. Value is 256.

Maximum no. of cells that can be served by a

This message

interface.

This message is sent by the NG-RAN node and
is used for carrying NRPPa message over the NG interface.

transfer trace specific information.

elementList.description: This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [11] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.3.3.5), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [11] (last 2 octets).

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [11]

definitionList.name: LOCATION REPORTING CONTROL
descriptionList:
This message is used by the AMF to request the NG-RAN node to report the
location of the UE.

definitionList.name: LOCATION REPORTING FAILURE INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node and is used to
indicate the failure of location reporting.

location.

definitionList.name: UE CAPABILITY INFO INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
provide UE capability related information to the AMF.

definitionList.name: UE RADIO CAPABILITY CHECK REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the AMF to request
the NG-RAN node to check the compatibility between the UE radio capabilities
and network configuration on IMS voice.

definitionList.name: UE RADIO CAPABILITY CHECK RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the NG-RAN node to
report IMS voice compatibility between the UE radio capabilities and network
configuration.

definitionList.name: Message Type
descriptionList:
The Message Type IE uniquely
identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

elementList.name: Type of Message
elementList.type: CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

definitionList.name: Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Cause IE is to
indicate the reason for a particular event for the NGAP protocol.

elementList.name: Radio Network Layer Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Unspecified, TXnRELOCOverall expiry, Successful handover, Release due to NG-RAN generated reason, Release due to 5GC generated reason, Handover cancelled, Partial handover, Handover failure in target 5GC/NG-RAN node or target system, Handover target not allowed, TNGRELOCoverall expiry, TNGRELOCprep expiry, Cell not available, Unknown target ID, No radio resources available in target cell, Unknown local UE NGAP ID, Inconsistent remote UE NGAP ID, Handover desirable for radio reasons, Time critical handover, Resource optimisation handover, Reduce load in serving cell, User inactivity, Radio connection with UE lost, Load balancing TAU required, Radio resources not available, Invalid QoS combination, Failure in the radio interface procedure, Interaction with other procedure, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Encryption and/or integrity protection algorithms not supported, NG intra system handover triggered, NG inter system handover triggered, Xn handover triggered, Not supported 5QI value, UE context transfer, IMS voice EPS fallback or RAT fallback triggered, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Slice not supported, UE in RRC_INACTIVE state not reachable, …)

elementList.name: NAS Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Normal release, Authentication failure, Deregister, Unspecified, …)

elementList.name: Protocol Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Transfer syntax error, Abstract syntax error (reject), Abstract syntax error (ignore and notify), Message not compatible with receiver state, Semantic error, Abstract syntax error (falsely constructed message), Unspecified, …)

elementList.name: Miscellaneous Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Control processing overload, Not enough user plane processing resources, Hardware failure, O&M intervention, Unknown PLMN, Unspecified, …)

definitionList.name: Criticality Diagnostics
descriptionList:
The Criticality Diagnostics IE is
sent by the NG-RAN node or the AMF when parts of a received message have not
been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors.
When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended
or were missing.

For further details on how to use the Criticality
Diagnostics IE, see clause 10.

elementList.name: Procedure Code
elementList.description: Used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.

elementList.name: Triggering Message
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
elementList.description: Used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

elementList.name: Procedure Criticality
elementList.description: Used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

elementList.name: IE Criticality
elementList.description: Used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value 'ignore' shall not be used.

elementList.name: IE ID
elementList.description: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of IE errors allowed to be reported
  with a single message. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of bits
delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided
by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum
or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate.

elementList.name: Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s

definitionList.name: Global RAN Node ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an NG-RAN node (see TS 38.300 [8]).

definitionList.name: Global gNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [8]).

elementList.name: gNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.

definitionList.name: NR CGI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [8]).

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.3.1.6).

definitionList.name: Global ng-eNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [8]).

elementList.name: Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Short Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Long Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: E-UTRA CGI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [17]).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.3.1.8).

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates QoS parameters for a GBR
QoS flow for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Details in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Details in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided there is data to deliver) in DL. Details in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided there is data to deliver). Details in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Notification Control
elementList.description: Details in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Details in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Details in TS 23.501 [9].

definitionList.name: PDU Session List
descriptionList: This IE contains a list of PDU sessions with a cause value. It is used for example to indicate failed PDU session(s) or PDU session(s) to be released.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of PDU sessions allowed towards one
  UE. Value is 256.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS parameters to be
applied to a QoS flow.

elementList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
elementList.description: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS Flows only.

elementList.name: Reflective QoS Attribute
elementList.description: Details in TS 23.501 [9]. This IE may be present in case of non-GBR QoS flows and shall be ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Additional QoS Flow Information
elementList.description: This IE indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of non-GBR QoS flows and shall be ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: PPI
elementList.description: Paging Policy Indicator used in PPD (Paging Policy Differentiation). See details in TS 23.501 [9]. This IE applies to PDU sessions of IP type.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of QoS flows with a cause value. It is used for
example to indicate failed QoS flow(s) or QoS flow(s) to be released.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one
  PDU session. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Trace Activation
descriptionList:
This IE defines parameters related to a
trace session activation.

elementList.name: NG-RAN Trace ID
elementList.description: This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [11] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.3.3.1), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [11] (last 2 octets).

elementList.name: Interfaces to Trace
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an NG-RAN node interface: first bit = NG-C, second bit = Xn-C, third bit = Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates 'should be traced'. Value '0' indicates 'should not be traced'.

elementList.name: Trace Depth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (minimum, medium, maximum, minimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, mediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, maximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, …)
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [11].

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [11]

definitionList.name: RRC Inactive Assistance Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides assistance information for
RRC_INACTIVE state.

elementList.name: UE Identity Index Value
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

elementList.name: UE Specific DRX
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

elementList.name: Periodic Registration Update Timer
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of TAIs. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: User Location Information
descriptionList:
This IE is used to provide location
information of the UE.

elementList.name: IP Address
elementList.description: UE's local IP address used to reach the N3IWF

elementList.name: Port Number
elementList.description: UDP or TCP source port number if NAT is detected.

definitionList.name: Slice Support List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the list of supported
slices.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of signalled slice support items.
  Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the QoS Characteristics
for a Non-standardised or not pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Priority Level is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Packet Error Rate
elementList.description: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Delay Critical
elementList.description: Indicates whether the GBR QoS flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Averaging Window is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be
  present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS
  Flow Level QoS Parameters IE.

definitionList.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList:
This IE specifies the relative importance
of a QoS flow compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of
NG-RAN resources.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE defines the relative importance of a resource request (see TS 23.501 [9]). Usage: Values are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., with 1 as the highest priority and 15 as the lowest priority. Further usage is defined in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows. Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flows or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows. The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to pre-emption of other QoS flows. Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. The Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Source to Target Transparent Container
descriptionList:
This IE is used to transparently pass radio
related information from the handover source to the handover target through the
core network; it is produced by
the source RAN node and is
transmitted to the target RAN node.

elementList.name: Source to Target Transparent Container
elementList.description: This IE includes a transparent container from the source RAN node to the target RAN node. The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the target system. Note: In the current version of the specification, this IE may carry either the Source NG-RAN Node to Target NG-RAN Node Transparent Container IE or the Source eNB to Target eNB Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 36.413 [16].

definitionList.name: Target to Source Transparent Container
descriptionList:
This IE is used to transparently pass radio
related information from the handover target to the handover source through the
core network; it is produced by
the target RAN node and is
transmitted to the source RAN
node.

elementList.name: Target to Source Transparent Container
elementList.description: This IE includes a transparent container from the target RAN node to the source RAN node. The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the target system. Note: In the current version of the specification, this IE may carry either the Target NG-RAN Node to Source NG-RAN Node Transparent Container IE or the Target eNB to Source eNB Transparent Container IE as defined in TS 36.413 [16].

definitionList.name: Handover Type
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates which kind of handover was triggered in the source side.

elementList.name: Handover Type
elementList.description: Intra5GS: NG-RAN node to NG-RAN node 5GStoEPS: NG-RAN node to eNB EPSto5GS: eNB to NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: MICO Mode Indication
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates that the UE is configured with MICO mode by
the AMF.

definitionList.name: S-NSSAI
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the S-NSSAI.

definitionList.name: Target ID
descriptionList:
This IE identifies the target for the
handover.

definitionList.name: Emergency Fallback Indicator
descriptionList: The IE indicates emergency service fallback.

definitionList.name: Security Indication
descriptionList:
This IE contains the user plane integrity protection
indication and confidentiality protection indication which indicates the
requirements on UP integrity protection and ciphering for corresponding PDU sessions,
respectively.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

definitionList.name: Non Dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the QoS Characteristics
for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: 5QI is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Priority Level is specified in TS 23.501 [9]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: This IE applies to GBR QoS flows only. Averaging Window is specified in TS 23.501 [9]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [9]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

definitionList.name: Source NG-RAN Node to Target NG-RAN Node Transparent Container
descriptionList:
This IE is produced by the source NG-RAN node and is transmitted to the
target NG-RAN node. For inter-system
handovers to 5G, the IE is transmitted from the external handover source to the
target NG-RAN node.
This IE is transparent to the 5GC.

elementList.name: RRC Container
elementList.description: Includes the RRC HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in TS 38.331 [18] if the target is a gNB. Includes the RRC HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in TS 36.331 [21] if the target is an ng-eNB.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Information List
elementList.description: For intra-system handovers in NG-RAN.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resource Information Item IEs
DRBs to QoS Flows Mapping List
E-RAB Information List
elementList.description: For inter-system handovers to 5G.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of PDU sessions allowed towards one
  UE. Value is 256.

Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one
  PDU session. Value is 64.

Maximum no. of E-RABs allowed towards one UE.
  Value is 256.

definitionList.name: Target NG-RAN Node to Source NG-RAN Node Transparent Container
descriptionList:
This IE is produced by the target NG-RAN node and is transmitted to the
source NG-RAN node. For inter-system handovers to 5G, the IE is
transmitted from the target NG-RAN node to the external relocation source.
This IE is transparent to the 5GC.

elementList.name: RRC Container
elementList.description: Includes the RRC HandoverCommand message as defined in TS 38.331 [18] if the target is a gNB. Includes the RRC HandoverCommand message as defined in TS 36.331 [21] if the target is an ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: Allowed NSSAI
descriptionList: This IE contains the allowed NSSAI.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of allowed S-NSSAI. Value is 8.

definitionList.name: Relative AMF Capacity
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the relative processing
capacity of an AMF with respect to the other AMFs in the AMF Set in order to
load-balance AMFs within an AMF Set defined in TS 23.501 [9].

definitionList.name: DL Forwarding
descriptionList:
This IE indicates that the QoS flow or E-RAB is proposed for forwarding
of downlink packets.

definitionList.name: DRBs to QoS Flows Mapping List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of DRBs containing
information about the mapped QoS flows.

elementList.name: DRBs to QoS Flows Mapping Item IEs
QoS Flow Mapping List
elementList.description: Contains information of the QoS flows mapped to the DRB

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of DRBs allowed towards one UE.
  Value is 32.

Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one
  PDU session. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Message Identifier
descriptionList:
This IE identifies the warning message. It
is set by the AMF and transferred to the UE by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Message Identifier
elementList.description: This IE is set by the 5GC, transferred to the UE by the NG-RAN node. The NG-RAN node shall treat it as an identifier of the message.

definitionList.name: Serial Number
descriptionList:
This IE identifies a particular message
from the source and type indicated by the Message Identifier and is altered
every time the message with a given Message Identifier is changed.

definitionList.name: Warning Area List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
the areas where the warning message needs to be broadcast or cancelled.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for warning
  message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of TAI subject for warning message
  broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area ID subject for
  warning message broadcast. Value is 65535.

definitionList.name: Number of Broadcasts Requested
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
the number of times a message is to be broadcast.

definitionList.name: Warning Type
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
types of the disaster. This IE also indicates that a Primary Notification is
included. This IE can be used by the UE to differentiate the type of alert
according to the type of disaster.

definitionList.name: Warning Security Information
descriptionList:
This IE provides
the security information needed for securing the Primary Notification.

definitionList.name: Data Coding Scheme
descriptionList:
This IE identifies
the alphabet or coding employed for the message characters and message handling
at the UE (it is passed transparently from the 5GC to the UE).

definitionList.name: Warning Message Contents
descriptionList:
This IE contains user information, e.g., the message with warning contents,
and will be broadcast over the radio interface.

definitionList.name: Broadcast Completed Area List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
the areas where either resources are available to perform the broadcast or
where broadcast is performed successfully.

elementList.name: Completed Cell in Emergency Area ID List
Completed Cell in Emergency Area ID List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for warning
  message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of TAI subject for warning message
  broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area ID subject for
  warning message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Cell ID within a TAI. Value is
  65535.

Maximum no. of Cell ID within an Emergency
  Area. Value is 65535.

definitionList.name: Broadcast Cancelled Area List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the areas where broadcast
was stopped successfully.

elementList.name: Cancelled Cell in Emergency Area ID List
Cancelled Cell in Emergency Area ID List

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Cell ID subject for warning
  message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of TAI subject for warning message
  broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Emergency Area ID subject for
  warning message broadcast. Value is 65535.

Maximum no. of Cell ID within a TAI. Value is
  65535.

Maximum no. of Cell ID within an Emergency
  Area. Value is 65535.

definitionList.name: Number of Broadcasts
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of
times that a particular message has been broadcast in a given warning area.

elementList.name: Number of Broadcasts
elementList.description: This IE is set to '0' if valid results are not known or not available. It is set to 65535 if the counter results have overflowed.

definitionList.name: Concurrent Warning Message Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE indicates to the NG-RAN node that
the received warning message is a new message to be scheduled for concurrent
broadcast with any other ongoing broadcast of warning messages.

elementList.name: Concurrent Warning Message Indicator
elementList.description: This IE is used to identify a PWS type warning system which allows the broadcast of multiple concurrent warning messages over the radio.

definitionList.name: Cancel-All Warning Messages Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE indicates to the NG-RAN node to
stop all already ongoing broadcast of warning messages in the NG-RAN node or in
an area.

definitionList.name: Emergency Area ID
descriptionList:
This IE is used to
indicate the area which has the emergency impact.

elementList.name: Emergency Area ID
elementList.description: Emergency Area ID may consist of several cells. Emergency Area ID is defined by the operator.

definitionList.name: Repetition Period
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the periodicity of the warning message to be broadcast.

elementList.name: Repetition Period
elementList.description: The unit of value 1 to 217-1 is [second].

definitionList.name: PDU Session ID
descriptionList:
This IE identifies a PDU Session for a UE.
The definition and use of the PDU Session ID is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE identifies a QoS flow within a PDU
Session. The definition and use of the QoS Flow Indicator is specified in TS
23.501 [9].

definitionList.name: PDU Session Type
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the PDU Session Type as
specified in TS 23.501 [9].

definitionList.name: DRB ID
descriptionList: This IE contains the DRB ID.

definitionList.name: Masked IMEISV
descriptionList: This IE contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment.

elementList.name: Masked IMEISV
elementList.description: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [23] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1. The first to fourth bits correspond to the first digit of the IMEISV, the fifth to eighth bits correspond to the second digit of the IMEISV, and so on.

definitionList.name: KAMF Change Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE indicates if the K_AFM_CI
information is present or not.

definitionList.name: Time to Wait
descriptionList:
This IE
defines the minimum allowed waiting time.

definitionList.name: Global N3IWF ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an N3IWF.

definitionList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE is applicable for all non-GBR QoS
flows per UE which is defined for the downlink and the uplink direction and a
subscription parameter provided by the AMF to the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [9] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [9] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: Security Result
descriptionList:
This IE indicates whether the security
policy indicated as "preferred" in the Security Indication IE is
performed or not.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

definitionList.name: User Plane Security Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates user plane security
information related to security policy.

definitionList.name: Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to define local configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities
in Idle mode and control of inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in Active mode
(see TS 23.501 [9]).

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Accepted
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates that the NG-RAN node
accepts the proposed DL data forwarding for the QoS flow which is subject to data forwarding.

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Not Possible
descriptionList:
This IE indicates that the 5GC decided that the corresponding PDU session will not
be subject to data forwarding.

definitionList.name: Direct Forwarding Path Availability
descriptionList:
This IE indicates whether a direct
forwarding path is available.

definitionList.name: Location Reporting Request Type
descriptionList: This IE indicates the type of location request to be handled by the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Event Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (direct, change of service cell, UE presence in the area of interest, stop change of service cell, stop UE presence in the area of interest, cancel location reporting for the UE, …)

elementList.name: Location Reporting Reference ID to be Cancelled

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of areas of interest. Value is 64.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be
  present if the Event Type IE is set to "stop UE presence in the
  area of interest".

definitionList.name: Area of Interest
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the area of interest.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of areas of interest. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: UE Presence in Area of Interest List
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the UE presence in the area of interest.

elementList.name: UE Presence in Area of Interest Item IEs

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of areas of interest. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: UE Radio Capability for Paging
descriptionList:
This IE
contains paging specific UE Radio Capability information.

elementList.name: UE Radio Capability for Paging
elementList.description: RRC Container, as defined in TS 38.331 [18].

definitionList.name: Assistance Data for Paging
descriptionList: This IE provides assistance information for paging optimisation.

definitionList.name: Assistance Data for Recommended Cells
descriptionList: This IE provides assistance information for paging in recommended cells.

definitionList.name: Recommended Cells for Paging
descriptionList:
This IE
contains the recommended cells for paging.
This IE is transparent to the 5GC.

elementList.name: Recommended Cell Item IEs
elementList.description: Includes visited and non-visited cells, where visited cells are listed in the order the UE visited them with the most recent cell being the first in the list. Non-visited cells are included immediately after the visited cell they are associated with.

elementList.name: Time Stayed in Cell
elementList.description: This is included for visited cells and indicates the time a UE stayed in a cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095 seconds, this IE is set to 4095.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of recommended Cells. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Paging Attempt Information
descriptionList:
This IE includes information related to the
paging count over NG.

elementList.name: Paging Attempt Count
elementList.description: Shall be set as specified in TS 38.300 [8].

elementList.name: Intended Number of Paging Attempts
elementList.description: Intended number of paging attempts (see TS 38.300 [8]).

elementList.name: Next Paging Area Scope
elementList.description: Indicates whether the paging area scope will change or not at next paging attempt. Usage specified in TS 38.300 [8].

definitionList.name: NG-RAN CGI
descriptionList:
This IE is used to globally identify a cell
in NG-RAN.

definitionList.name: UE Radio Capability
descriptionList:
This IE contains UE Radio Capability
information.

elementList.name: UE Radio Capability
elementList.description: RRC Container, as defined in TS 38.331 [18].

definitionList.name: Time Stamp
descriptionList: This IE contains UTC time information.

elementList.name: Time Stamp
elementList.description: Encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [25]. It indicates the UTC time when the location information was generated.

definitionList.name: Location Reporting Reference ID
descriptionList:
This IE contains the Location Reporting
Reference ID.

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Response DRB List
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates data forwarding related information.

elementList.name: Data Forwarding Response DRB Item IEs

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of DRBs allowed towards one UE.
  Value is 32.

definitionList.name: Paging Priority
descriptionList:
This element indicates the paging priority
for paging a UE.

elementList.name: Paging Priority
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (PrioLevel1, PrioLevel2, PrioLevel3, PrioLevel4, PrioLevel5, PrioLevel6, PrioLevel7, PrioLevel8, …)
elementList.description: Lower value codepoint indicates higher priority.

definitionList.name: Packet Loss Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate.

elementList.name: Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

definitionList.name: Packet Delay Budget
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget.

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

definitionList.name: Packet Error Rate
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate.

elementList.name: Packet Error Rate
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

definitionList.name: Averaging Window
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Averaging Window.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

definitionList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst
Volume.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

definitionList.name: Priority Level
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Priority Level.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined

definitionList.name: Mobility Restriction List
descriptionList:
This IE defines roaming or access
restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the NR-RAN provides
information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g.,
handover, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation or for assigning
proper RNAs. If the NG-RAN receives the Mobility Restriction List IE, it
shall overwrite previously received mobility restriction information. NG-RAN
behaviour upon receiving this IE is specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: Equivalent PLMNs
elementList.description: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of "equivalent PLMNs" as defined in TS 24.501 [26]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

elementList.name: RAT Restrictions
elementList.description: This IE contains RAT restriction related information as specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: RAT Restriction Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. This version of the specification does not use bits 2-7, the sending node shall set bits 2-7 to "0", the receiving node shall ignore bits 2-7.

elementList.name: Forbidden Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Forbidden Area information as specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the forbidden TAI.

elementList.name: Service Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Service Area Restriction information as specified in TS 23.501 [9].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the allowed TAI.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the not-allowed TAI.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of equivalent PLMNs. Value is 15.
Maximum no. of allowed PLMNs. Value is 16.

Maximum no. of forbidden Tracking Area Codes.
  Value is 4096.

Maximum no. of allowed or not allowed Tracking
  Areas. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: UE Security Capabilities
descriptionList:
This IE defines the supported algorithms
for encryption and integrity protection in the UE.

elementList.name: NR Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other algorithm than NEA0, "first bit" – 128-NEA1, "second bit" – 128-NEA2, "third bit" – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [13].

elementList.name: NR Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other algorithm than NIA0, "first bit" – 128-NIA1, "second bit" – 128-NIA2, "third bit" – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [13].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, "first bit" – 128-EEA1, "second bit" – 128-EEA2, "third bit" – 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [27].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, "first bit" – 128-EIA1, "second bit" – 128-EIA2, "third bit" – 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [27].

definitionList.name: Security Key
descriptionList:
This IE is used to apply security in the
NG-RAN for different scenarios as defined in TS 33.501 [13].

elementList.name: Security Key
elementList.description: Key material for NG-RAN node or Next Hop Key as defined in TS 33.501 [13]

definitionList.name: Security Context
descriptionList:
This IE provides security related
parameters to the NG-RAN node which are used to derive security keys for user
plane traffic and RRC signalling messages and for security parameter generation
for subsequent mobility, see TS 33.501 [13].

elementList.name: Next Hop Chaining Count
elementList.description: Next Hop Chaining Counter (NCC) defined in TS 33.501 [13].

elementList.name: Next-Hop NH
elementList.description: The NH together with the NCC is used to derive the security configuration as defined in TS 33.501 [13].

definitionList.name: IMS Voice Support Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE is set by the NG-RAN node to
indicate whether the UE radio capabilities are compatible with the network
configuration for IMS voice.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of connectivity allowed for a UE.
  Value is 8. The current
  version of the specification supports up to 2 connectivity.

Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one
  PDU session. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: UP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This IE is used to provide the NG user
plane transport layer information associated with a PDU session for an NG-RAN
node – AMF pair. In this release it corresponds to an
IP address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

definitionList.name: E-RAB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is the
identifier of the LTE E-RAB.

definitionList.name: Transport Layer Address
descriptionList:
This IE is
an IP address.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: The Radio Network Layer is not supposed to interpret the address information. It should pass it to the Transport Layer for interpretation. For details, see TS 38.414 [14].

definitionList.name: GTP-TEID
descriptionList:
This IE is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint
Identifier to be used for the user plane transport between the NG-RAN node and
the UPF.

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [15].

definitionList.name: CP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to provide the NG control plane transport layer information associated
with an NG-RAN node – AMF pair.

definitionList.name: TNL Association List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of TNL
associations. It is used for example to indicate failed TNL association(s).

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of TNL Associations between the
  NG-RAN node and the AMF. Value is 32.

definitionList.name: AMF UE NGAP ID
descriptionList:
This IE uniquely identifies the UE
association over the NG interface within the AMF.

definitionList.name: RAN UE NGAP ID
descriptionList:
This IE
uniquely identifies the UE association over the NG interface within the NG-RAN
node.

definitionList.name: GUAMI
descriptionList: This IE indicates the AMF identity.

definitionList.name: NAS-PDU
descriptionList:
This IE
contains a 5GC – UE or UE – 5GC
message that is transferred without interpretation in the NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: PLMN Identity
descriptionList: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

definitionList.name: SON Configuration Transfer
descriptionList:
This IE contains the configuration
information, used by e.g., SON functionality, and additionally includes the NG-RAN
node identifier of the destination of this configuration information and the NG-RAN
node identifier of the source of this information.

elementList.name: Xn TNL Configuration Info
elementList.description: Source NG-RAN node Xn TNL Configuration Info.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be
  present if the SON Information IE contains the SON Information
  Request IE set to "Xn TNL Configuration Info"

definitionList.name: SON Information
descriptionList:
This IE identifies the nature of the
configuration information transferred, i.e., a request, a reply or a report.

definitionList.name: SON Information Reply
descriptionList:
This IE contains the configuration
information to be replied to the NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Xn TNL Configuration Info
descriptionList:
This IE is used for signalling Xn TNL
Configuration information for automatic Xn SCTP association establishment.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Addresses for Xn SCTP endpoint.

elementList.name: IP-Sec Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint.

elementList.name: GTP Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points (used for data forwarding over Xn).

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of Xn Transport Layer Addresses for
  an SCTP end-point. Value is 2.

Maximum no. of Xn Extended Transport Layer
  Addresses in the message. Value is 16.

Maximum no. of Xn GTP Transport Layer Addresses
  for a GTP end-point in the message. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: TAC
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area Code.

definitionList.name: TAI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area.

definitionList.name: AMF Set ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to uniquely identify an AMF Set within the AMF Region.

definitionList.name: Routing ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to identify an LMF within the 5GC.

definitionList.name: NRPPa-PDU
descriptionList:
This IE
contains an NG-RAN node – LMF or LMF – NG-RAN node message that is transferred
without interpretation in the AMF.

definitionList.name: RAN Paging Priority
descriptionList:
This IE
contains the service priority as defined in TS 23.501 [9].

definitionList.name: EPS TAC
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to uniquely identify an EPS Tracking Area Code.

definitionList.name: EPS TAI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to uniquely identify an EPS Tracking Area.

definitionList.name: UE Paging Identity
descriptionList:
This IE
represents the Identity with which the UE is paged.

definitionList.name: AMF Pointer
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to uniquely identify an AMF within the AMF Set.

definitionList.name: 5G-S-TMSI
descriptionList:
This IE is used for security reasons, to
hide the identity of a subscriber.

elementList.name: 5G-TMSI
elementList.description: 5G-TMSI is unique within the AMF that allocated it.

definitionList.name: AMF Name
descriptionList:
This IE is used to uniquely identify the
AMF (see TS 38.300 [8]). It may also be used as a human readable name of the AMF.

definitionList.name: Paging Origin
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates whether Paging is originated due to the PDU sessions from the
non-3GPP access.
